intro: Verbascum zaianense, commonly known as the Zaian mullein, is a perennial plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Its leaves are broad and woolly, providing a distinctive appearance, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Verbascum zaianense is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
